Package com.springproject.orgschart.controller

Class EmployeeController

java.lang.Object
com.springproject.orgschart.controller.EmployeeController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api") public class EmployeeController extends Object
The EmployeeController class handles HTTP requests related to employee management. It provides endpoints for retrieving, adding, updating, and deleting employees.

      Constructs a new EmployeeController with the specified EmployeeServiceImplementation.

  • Method Details

    • getAllEmployeesSortedByName

      @GetMapping("/employees") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<EmployeeDTO>> getAllEmployeesSortedByName()
      Retrieves a list of all employees sorted by name.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the list of EmployeeDTO objects and HTTP status 200 (OK).

    • getEmployeeOrganizationChart

      @GetMapping("/employees/{employeeId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<OrganizationChartDTO> getEmployeeOrganizationChart(@PathVariable Long employeeId)
      Retrieves the organization chart for a specific employee.
      Parameters:
      employeeId - The ID of the employee.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the OrganizationChartDTO for the employee and HTTP status 200 (OK).

    • addEmployee

      @PostMapping("/employees") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<EmployeeDTO> addEmployee(@RequestBody EmployeeDTO employeeDTO)
      Adds a new employee.
      Parameters:
      employeeDTO - The EmployeeDTO object representing the new employee to be added.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the created EmployeeDTO and HTTP status 201 (Created).

    • updateEmployee

      @PutMapping("/employees/{employeeId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> updateEmployee(@PathVariable Long employeeId, @RequestBody EmployeeDTO employeeDTO)
      Updates an existing employee's details.
      Parameters:
      employeeId - The ID of the employee to be updated.
      employeeDTO - The EmployeeDTO object containing the updated employee details.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with a success message and HTTP status 200 (OK) if the update is successful, or an error message and HTTP status 400 (Bad Request) if the update fails.
      Throws:
      EmployeeNotFoundException - if the employee with the specified ID is not found.

    • deleteEmployee

      @DeleteMapping("/employees/{employeeId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> deleteEmployee(@PathVariable Long employeeId)
      Deletes an employee.
      Parameters:
      employeeId - The ID of the employee to be deleted.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with a success message and HTTP status 200 (OK) if the deletion is successful, or an error message and HTTP status 403 (Forbidden) if the deletion is not allowed.
